paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 was diagnosed with cardiac amyloidosis at age 62.
Patient P2 presented with restrictive cardiomyopathy at age 69.
Patient P3 was evaluated at age 72 and reported no symptoms.

functional_data.summary: Functional assays indicate that TTR mutations lead to destabilization of the protein structure, promoting amyloid fibril formation.

variants.population_frequency: V122I variant is present in 3-4% of Black Americans.
variants.additional_notes: The penetrance data is based on a cohort study.
key_quotes: Most causative ATTRv amyloidosis mutations are gain-of-function ones with autosomal dominant inheritance, albeit with highly variable penetrance and expressivity, even within the same family.
The true penetrance for amyloid mutations has largely not been established pathologically.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted from the main text, with no tables available.
